trans-unit.source: Contains information related to the version of SOAP associated with a message and its exchange.
The SOAP versions currently available are SOAP 1.1 and SOAP 1.2.

There is an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> for each of these versions of SOAP that can be recovered using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap11%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.Soap12%2A> properties.
There is also a <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> message version that is used to sent and receive XML messages that do not use SOAP formatting.

The processing roles associated with each message version can be recovered using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.NextDestinationActorValue%2A> property and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.GetUltimateDestinationActorValues%2A> method.
Gets a string that contains the URI name for the SOAP role associated with the current message version for the ultimate destination.
The ultimate receiver is `null` if <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> is specified.
An empty string if SOAP1.1 is used; a string that contains http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/ultimateReceiver if SOAP1.2 is used.
Gets a string that contains the URI name for the SOAP role associated with the current message version for the next destination.

A string that contains http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/actor/next if SOAP1.1 is used; a string that contains http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/next if SOAP1.2 is used; and an empty string if the message version is none.
Gets the envelope version not using a version of SOAP.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None%2A> message version is used this means that a SOAP envelope is not written out and the message emits the contents of the body.
This enables an [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] channel to communicate with an endpoint that is expecting XML with no SOAP formatting.
The XML payload lives in the body of a message and is the only thing emitted when it hits the encoder.
Similarly, when the arbitrary chunk of XML is received it is wrapped up in a Message for propagation up the channel stack.
The required headers are inserted and the message is processed as if it had been a SOAP message.
The envelope version not using a SOAP formatting.
Gets the SOAP1.1 envelope version.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)] the schema for [SOAP 1.1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96641).
The SOAP1.1 <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> object.
Gets the SOAP1.2 envelope version.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)] the schema for [SOAP 1.2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96642).
The SOAP1.2 <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> object.
Gets a string that represents the current envelope version.
This method returns a human-readable string that is culture-sensitive.
The string representation of the current envelope version.
